
Two users reused the same prime to generate their RSA keys. Your mission: recover the original message hidden in 629631136126010474448677678751672228026402584721776037735201842620652454461348667169501266685387067911744488521429059280059422655143050754976433401031566499872782330419048279566647874332680609945846567538363028052314122494385472103.


The flag format is flag{...}
n=863830755022724547570924280873713468538878406361128085989973436674600245489692142676167570492060907802694072758969536414730000502209955805870234593804277086798078292273388291205198368626468660942303860760202841639901178805597093733, n2=1234700619249546441354078569470537868796076499245676115728233670310931291598051867630507957218157149162221114097788957503246970982987132035253541733462613389190610518001223347697201507254098164683262707792034013568013327256560303019, e=6754921697608986145494656336261081449939650534193473833091862426123436745763699529173578722851696114858547294426743511990436421037218893963101113711094813010283840162707222013739893300049598095197600804158475434190357954784963273

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{kxh06mr3}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 629631136126010474448677678751672228026402584721776037735201842620652454461348667169501266685387067911744488521429059280059422655143050754976433401031566499872782330419048279566647874332680609945846567538363028052314122494385472103
vulnerability: shared prime
hint: When two RSA moduli share a common prime, computing GCD(n, n2) can reveal the shared prime factor.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
